SETTINGS.SimpleMacroShorthandL: Enable a shortened macro syntax which allows referencing attributes directly, for example @str instead of @attributes.str.value. Disable this setting if you need the ability to reference the full attribute model, for example @attributes.str.label.
SETTINGS.SimpleInitFormulaL: Enter an initiative formula, such as d20+@dex
SIMPLE.NotifyGroupAttrDuplicate: Attribute group already exists as an attribute.
SIMPLE.NotifyGroupAlphanumeric: Attribute group names may not contain spaces or periods.
SIMPLE.NotifyGroupReserved: Attribute group "{key}" is reserved and cannot be used.
SIMPLE.NotifyAttrDuplicate: Attribute key already exists as a group.
SIMPLE.NotifyAttrInvalid: Attribute keys may not contain spaces or periods.
SIMPLE.DeleteGroupContent: Do you wish to delete this group? This will delete the following group and all attributes included in it:
SIMPLE.Rule.ActionRoll: = 1d6 (+one Trait)(+one Object)(+one advantaging circumstance)(+one Trait of a helping PC)(+ Object of a helping PC). You roll 4d6 maximum; the action is a success if one die rolls 5 or 6
SIMPLE.Rule.RemoveDie: when Harmed (non cumulative) / when confronting an Enemy
SIMPLE.Rule.Equipment: I have this object on a 5 or a 6 if it makes sense (roll 1d6 + / â€” dice depending on circumstances)
SIMPLE.Rule.ObjectFromTheMall: they break on a 5 or a 6 (roll 1d6, +1d if I don't take good care of them, -1d if I'm careful)
SIMPLE.ActionDialog.Title: Action Roll
SIMPLE.ActionDialog.Harms: Harms will be taken into account automatically.
SIMPLE.ActionDialog.Traits: I use one of my traits?
SIMPLE.ActionDialog.Equipments: I use one of my objects?
SIMPLE.ActionDialog.OtherPJHelpTrait: Another PC is helping me with one of their traits?
SIMPLE.ActionDialog.OtherPJHelpObject: Another PC is helping me with one of their objects?
